H0.text: Orbitals are the three-dimensional spaces with specific shapes that are components of electron shells.

H1.text: Arrays are the three-dimensional spaces with specific shapes that are components of electron shells.

H2.text: Isotopes are the three-dimensional spaces with specific shapes that are components of electron shells.

H3.text: Venticales are the three‑dimensional spaces with specific shapes that are components of electron shells.

A4.text: Atomic orbitals are basic building blocks of the atomic orbital model (or electron cloud or wave mechanics model), a modern framework for visualizing submicroscopic behavior of electrons in matter.

A5.text: The electron cloud of an atom may be seen as being built up (in approximation) in an electron configuration that is a product of simpler hydrogen‑like atomic orbitals.
